page.title: 19NEWICK PLAYGROUND GAMES
page.content: The infants don't play proper games. They play chase and act out television programmes.They do alot of pretending. The older boys only play football, but some of them like joining in with our games (or messing them up!). The girls play ordinary skipping and French skipping, for which you need a very long loop of elastic. We play catch and hopscotch, which is marked out on the playground.We also play'52 Bonker' (which is also called 'forty-forty' or 'pom-pom 1-2-3'), where we have to hide and then get back to base without the person, who is 'up', catching us. Most of our games involve chasing and catching and have rather strange names like 'Nuts, bolts and screws','My red letter', 'Polo', 'Mother may I?' and 'Lollipop shop'.
